meanings.sent1: The constant noise of the city traffic was inuring him to loud sounds.
meanings.sent2: She was inuring herself to the bitter taste of the medicine by taking it every day.
meanings.sent3: The spooky stories were inuring the children to the idea of ghosts, making them less scared.
meanings.sent4: The challenging hikes were inuring him to physical exhaustion, making him stronger.
meanings.sent5: The harsh weather conditions were inuring the explorers to the extreme cold.

meanings.definition: To become accustomed to something through prolonged exposure
meanings.sent1: The students were inuring themselves to the long hours of studying for exams.
meanings.sent2: Living near the train tracks, she was inuring to the sound of passing trains.
meanings.sent3: The constant practice was inuring the athletes to the pressure of competition.
meanings.sent4: The daily walks were inuring her to the beauty of nature around her.
meanings.sent5: The repetitive tasks were inuring him to the monotony of his job.
